Package server.services

Class UserService

java.lang.Object
server.services.UserService
public final class UserService
extends java.lang.Object
Stores users and their related attributes

  • Method Details

    • subscribeToDeletionEvents

      public static void subscribeToDeletionEvents​(int userId, java.lang.Runnable onUserDeletion) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, java.sql.SQLException
      Registers the given method to be run if the specified user is deleted
      Parameters:
      userId - the userId of the user to check
      onUserDeletion - the method to be run
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified user does not exist
      java.sql.SQLException - if there was an error accessing the SQL server

    • unsubscribeFromDeletionEvents

      public static void unsubscribeFromDeletionEvents​(int userId, java.lang.Runnable callback)
      Unregisters the given method from being run when the specified user is deleted
      Parameters:
      userId - the userId of the user being checked
      callback - the method which would be run

    • checkUserIdExistance

      public static boolean checkUserIdExistance​(int userId) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Checks if the given userid corresponds to an existing user
      Parameters:
      userId - the userid to check
      Returns:
      whether the given userid corresponds to an existing user
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if there was an error accessing the SQL server

    • checkUserExistance

      public static boolean checkUserExistance​(java.lang.String username) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Checks if the given username corresponds to an existing user
      Parameters:
      username - the username to check
      Returns:
      whether the given user is registered
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if there was an error accessing the SQL server

    • createUser

      public static void createUser​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, java.sql.SQLException
      Registers the given user
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user to create
      password - the password of the user to create
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the userId of the given user is invalid or already registered
      java.sql.SQLException - if there was an error accessing the SQL server

    • deleteUser

      public static void deleteUser​(java.lang.String username) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, java.lang.SecurityException, java.sql.SQLException
      Deletes the specified user
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user to delete
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified user does not exist
      java.sql.SQLException - if there was an error accessing the SQL server
      java.lang.SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to delete the specified user

    • getUserId

      public static int getUserId​(java.lang.String username) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, java.lang.SecurityException, java.sql.SQLException
      Retrieves the userId corresponding to the specified username
      Parameters:
      username - the username to fetch the id for
      Returns:
      the id of the user corresponding to the specified username
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified user does not exist
      java.lang.SecurityException - if the current user does not have the permissions to fetch this user's id
      java.sql.SQLException - if there was an error accessing the SQL server

    • getUsername

      public static java.lang.String getUsername​(int userId) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, java.lang.SecurityException, java.sql.SQLException

      Returns:

      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified user does not exist
      java.lang.SecurityException - if the current user does not have the permissions to fetch this user's username
      java.sql.SQLException - if there was an error accessing the SQL server
